group_1.narration: <Dolma's Side>

group_1.textRight: I humbly request this of you.

group_1.textLeft: I know, I know!@Seriously, I get it!

group_1.narration: In exchange for their support,@I was requested to act as a bridge@between Heruka and the Order.
The Order… The Order of the White Hill@knows they can't beat the Mongols,@so they're negotiating for peace.
I have never lost my hatred for Mongols.@But with all the information I learned about@them from the Order, even I understand@that our victory was not realistic.
Because right now only one@of Khan's armies is attacking us…@Dolo'adai is simply one of four generals@belonging to their emperor's second son…@The other's are off attacking elsewhere.
We're not facing the entire Mongolian force or@even a main faction directly under the emperor.@This is truly just a tiny fraction of their armies.
Such a small percentage, and yet here@we stand on the brink of annihilation.@There's no way we can win against that.
That's why I've been thinking of ways@to bring peace between Mongolia and Tibet,@before they start getting serious.
The Mongol invasion resumed,@and villages everywhere were attacked.

group_1.textLeft: These blue flowers...

group_1.narration: "They are the symbol of our great Savior…@We pray to those flowers!"
"Please vanquish the Mongols and deliver us..."

group_1.textCenter: I'm sorry, but we can't beat the Mongols.@We have to make peace and stop fighting...

group_1.narration: "That's impossible!"
"We've lost so much because of those people…@There's no way we'll ever forgive them!"
"Even if you make peace with them,@we'll keep on fighting to the very end!@Therein lies our salvation!"

group_1.textRight: Oh, so some people managed to survive.@This way, everyone!

group_1.textLeft: W-wait…@I'm not here to fight you!
You understand what I'm saying, right?@We're trying to make peace between us…
[chara:833300:effect_7003_damage02][se:3001_chara_damage][bgEffect:shakeSmall]Eeek!

group_1.textRight: Going on and on about such stupid things…@Shall I start with you first?

group_1.textLeft: …Tch.

group_1.textRight: Hey… Wait!

group_1.narration: If we speak the same language, it's doable.@I'm sure they want to stop fighting too.@I'm sure we can even make peace.
Such a sweet idea…I thought it was possible@since I've come this far, but here we are,@still cutting each other's lives short.@This fighting will never end…
Fleeing with the Mongols hot at my heels…@It's just the same as when I ran away@from my hometown.
But back then…Heruka was holding my hand.
Yes… She was always by my side.@She reached out to me and promised@that everything would be okay@as long as I followed her lead…
Heruka was my beacon in the darkness.@My own special hope…
The light was so very beautiful.@I had to take care of her no matter what.@I thought I could protect her…
Just when I thought I had finally made it back,@my special place was engulfed in flames.
Those precious blue flowers@that Heruka cherished and nurtured,@the landscape engraved in our memories,@had all been defiled by the Mongols.

group_1.textLeft: D-Dolma?!@You came back?!

group_1.textRight: Where's Heruka?!

group_1.textLeft: She's not here!!@You came to the wrong place!!

group_1.textRight: Really…? That's a relief…

group_1.textLeft: I've found some people from the nunnery!

group_1.textRight: I-I hope nothing bad happens…@I hope the Buddha won't punish me…

group_1.textLeft: We'll either face the Buddha's judgment or@execution for insubordination.
…You wretches, what have we done to you@to deserve this?
We're just here living our lives.@Why are you doing this to us?
Well, I know that you don't have the power@to just stop fighting…

group_1.textRight: You… You can speak our language?

group_1.textCenter: Don't listen to her.@She's talking bullshit.

group_1.textLeft: BULLSHIT!!
SHUT UP!! SHUT UP!!
You should all just go away!@It's because of people like you…
That I have to be here!
You're why I have to cling to Heruka!

group_1.textRight: DOLMA!!

group_1.narration: Hey, Heruka.
I don't like it here.@It's so dark and scary.
Help me, Heruka…@Save me from this wretched world…
…Heruka…
I'm still unclean, aren't I?

group_1.textLeft: Ah…@Have you awakened, Dolma?

group_1.textRight: Heruka…?

group_1.textLeft: Yes, it seems…that you've become more@mature since I last saw you.

group_1.textRight: That's not true.@I haven't grown up at all.
…No matter how many times I said@I wanted to protect you…
It seems that I'm the one who truly@desired salvation.
Because, really…@What can I do now?
You've always known what to do, right?@I'm sure you can figure it out, yeah?
Sorry… I know you don't like it when I say@this kind of stuff…
Um… You know…

group_1.textLeft: …You're not the only one who wants@to be saved.
The same goes for everyone.

group_1.textRight: Even you, Heruka…?

group_1.textLeft: I…don't need saving anymore.@You've already done that for me.

group_1.textRight: I have? No way, you must be joking.

group_1.textLeft: I'm not lying.
You've always been so supportive and kind,@trying to make sure I never suffer again…
I've indulged in that warmth all my life,@running away from my past sins.

group_1.textRight: Sins? If you're talking about what happened@to our hometown, that wasn't your fault…

group_1.textLeft: At the very least, I was responsible@for bringing them hope.

group_1.textRight: Huh?!

group_1.textLeft: It must not stop halfway through. I must carry it@on through to the end.

group_1.textRight: Why…do you have to go that far?

group_1.narration: "Because I was born for that reason alone."
"I will end the fighting@and bring peace to the people.@I will live and die to fulfill my mission.@I've made up my mind on that."

group_1.textRight: That can't be.@It's way too tragic.

group_1.textLeft: It's okay…@I'm very blessed, you know?
Because… I can protect you, my precious Dolma,@with my own two hands.

group_1.textRight: Heruka…

group_1.textLeft: That's why… I must continue on.

group_1.textRight: But, that's…

group_1.textLeft: The things you wish to ask of me,@please say them.
I can do it. I don't mind.

group_1.textRight: …I'm sorry… I'm so sorry…
…Please put an end to this fighting,@O great Savior…

group_1.textLeft: …Don't worry.@I'll take care of it.

group_1.textRight: R-really…?

group_1.textLeft: Yes.@I've actually been working on a plan all along.
The only thing I had left to do was make@a decision.

group_1.textRight: Is it going to be dangerous?

group_1.textLeft: No, it won't be anything I can't handle.@Please have faith in me.

group_1.textRight: Yes, I believe in you.

group_1.narration: When Heruka's parents stopped being@parents and became mere devotees@to a savior, Heruka was very hurt.
I knew that and yet I clung to Heruka, as well.
Maybe that's the way hope is.@It was just too bright for me.
